metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: We will use the "books.xml" document in the examples below (same XML file as in the previous chapters).
content.html: We will use the "books.xml" document in the examples below (same XML file as in the previous chapters).

links.text: View the "books.xml" file in your browser

content.text: View the "books.xml" file in your browser .
content.html: View the "books.xml" file in your browser.

content.text: As we have seen in the previous chapters, we are selecting and filtering elements with either a Path expression or with a FLWOR expression.
content.html: As we have seen in the previous chapters, we are selecting and filtering elements with either a Path expression or with a FLWOR expression.

content.text: Look at the following FLWOR expression:

content.code:
for $x in doc("books.xml")/bookstore/book

where $x/price>30

order by $x/title

return $x/title
content.code_html:
for $x in doc("books.xml")/bookstore/book
where $x/price>30
order by $x/title
return $x/title

content.text: The for clause binds a variable to each item returned by the in expression. The for clause results in iteration. There can be multiple for clauses in the same FLWOR expression.
content.html: The for clause binds a variable to each item returned by the in expression. The for clause results in iteration. There can be multiple for clauses in the same FLWOR expression.

content.text: To loop a specific number of times in a for clause, you may use the to keyword:
content.html: To loop a specific number of times in a for clause, you may use the to keyword:

content.code_html:
for $x in (1 to 5)
return <test>{$x}</test>

<test>1</test>
<test>2</test>
<test>3</test>
<test>4</test>
<test>5</test>

content.text: The at keyword can be used to count the iteration:
content.html: The at keyword can be used to count the iteration:

content.code_html:
for $x at $i in doc("books.xml")/bookstore/book/title
return <book>{$i}. {data($x)}</book>

content.code:
<book>1. Everyday Italian</book>

<book>2. Harry Potter</book>

<book>3. XQuery Kick Start</book>

<book>4. Learning XML</book>
content.code_html:
<book>1. Everyday Italian</book>
<book>2. Harry Potter</book>
<book>3. XQuery Kick Start</book>
<book>4. Learning XML</book>

content.text: It is also allowed with more than one in expression in the for clause. Use comma to separate each in expression:
content.html: It is also allowed with more than one in expression in the for clause. Use comma to separate each in expression:

content.code:
for $x in (10,20), $y in (100,200)

return <test>x={$x} and y={$y}</test>
content.code_html:
for $x in (10,20), $y in (100,200)
return <test>x={$x} and y={$y}</test>

content.code:
<test>x=10 and y=100</test>

<test>x=10 and y=200</test>

<test>x=20 and y=100</test>

<test>x=20 and y=200</test>
content.code_html:
<test>x=10 and y=100</test>
<test>x=10 and y=200</test>
<test>x=20 and y=100</test>
<test>x=20 and y=200</test>

content.text: The let clause allows variable assignments and it avoids repeating the same expression many times. The let clause does not result in iteration.
content.html: The let clause allows variable assignments and it avoids repeating the same expression many times. The let clause does not result in iteration.

content.code_html: <test>1 2 3 4 5</test>

content.text: The where clause is used to specify one or more criteria for the result:
content.html: The where clause is used to specify one or more criteria for the result:

content.text: The order by clause is used to specify the sort order of the result. Here we want to order the result by category and title:
content.html: The order by clause is used to specify the sort order of the result. Here we want to order the result by category and title:

content.code:
for $x in doc("books.xml")/bookstore/book

order by $x/@category, $x/title

return $x/title
content.code_html:
for $x in doc("books.xml")/bookstore/book
order by $x/@category, $x/title
return $x/title

content.code:
<title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>

<title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>

<title lang="en">Learning XML</title>

<title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>
content.code_html:
<title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>
<title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>
<title lang="en">Learning XML</title>
<title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>

content.text: The return clause specifies what is to be returned.
content.html: The return clause specifies what is to be returned.

content.code_html:
for $x in doc("books.xml")/bookstore/book
return $x/title

content.code:
<title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>

<title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>

<title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>

<title lang="en">Learning XML</title>
content.code_html:
<title lang="en">Everyday Italian</title>
<title lang="en">Harry Potter</title>
<title lang="en">XQuery Kick Start</title>
<title lang="en">Learning XML</title>
